segments.text: I notice the mess that’s forming on the floor, a puddle growing, and it makes me feel uneasy.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman doesn’t seem to care, completely absorbed in drying that plate as if nothing else matters.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Why would she ignore the sound of water spilling all over the cabinets?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: And then the boy is up there, climbing like it’s a game, and I can’t believe how reckless he is being.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stool is tilting, and all I can think is how quickly everything could go wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Yet, there’s the girl, standing there with her palm open, waiting for a cookie like it’s the most important thing in the world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This kitchen, with its calm outside view, feels like a ticking time bomb right now.
segments.speaker: PAR
